label: 権門勢家
本: The Cambridge History of Japan, Volume 2:  Heian Japan . Cambridge University Press . 1999
説明文: To be a kemmon it was necessary to have (1) a well-organized house administratie structure; (2) shōen holdings as an economic base; (3) private military forces; and (4) the principle of patriarchal control by the house head (p. 640).
